::DevilDuer::

Motioning Threadshot and Catgut to be quiet, DevilDuer steps around 
the corner, looking at Diamond and seeing the drain. He was a bit 
surprized, he had had no idea that there were any drains whatsoever 
in the base that he had spent most of his life on earth in.

"Allright," he says, putting away his gun. He knew it would be 
useless to try and hit something so small anyways, and there were 
always autoguns and Threadshot and Catgut in case of trouble, "I 
gotta admit that yer good, but I neve' said that I wanted ya dead."

He frowns at the drain, "And don't bother with that thing, a command 
from me can lock it up."

In truth, he had no idea if the drain even had a locking system, he 
had never seen it before.

"Anyways, you look like yer a bot who knows what she's doin'. I think 
I said before that the Alliance is the superior faction on the 
planet, I think you'd do well with us. Ya got my word that I ain't 
gonna shot at ya no more if you come along peacefully. If ya give me 
a fight, I'm gonna shut that drain, sick the autoguns on ya, and 
we'll see where we get from there."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Diamond::
> 
> She transformed into bot and stood up, leaning against the wall for 
> support.  She was an assassin, not a muscled warrior.  "Oh yeah, 
> that's rich. You don't want to hurt me, you just want to kill me. 
I'm 
> not ready to meet the matrix yet.  I escaped from the Predacon 
> council, and I'll get out of here." she looked and hoped she would 
> find something.  She looked out into the middle of the cargo bay 
and 
> found just what she was looking for.  A small floor drain.  The 
last 
> place that they would think to find her and with luck, it would 
lead 
> outside.  She transformed into rattle snake and slithered towards 
the 
> drain.  She had a little trouble pulling the cover off the drain, 
but 
> kept talking to cover up audiably waht she was doing and hopefully 
> buy enough time for her to get away.  "You know, if things had been 
> different, I think I could have fallen for a bot like you.  I like 
> you.  Your as efficiant a killer as I.  Had we met up on Cybertron, 
I 
> think we might have made quite a pair."  She almost had the cover 
off.
> "Yeah, it's a shame that you want me dead so badly. I think we 
could 
> have made a good team." A little more and the cover would be off.
